rocks.bastion.core.builder

Interface AssertionsBuilder<MODEL>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CallbackBuilder<MODEL>, ExecuteRequestBuilder<MODEL>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BastionBuilder<MODEL>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BastionBuilderImpl

    public interface AssertionsBuilder<MODEL>
extends CallbackBuilder<MODEL>
    Defines the operations which a user can perform on a Bastion builder before any assertions object is added to the test. At this point, a user may perform one of the following:
    • withAssertions(Assertions): Specify what test assertions to apply to the response. We recommend supplying the assertions as a lambda or using one of the available subclass implementations of Assertions.
    • CallbackBuilder.thenDo(Callback): Specify a callback function to execute when the response is received and it passes its assertions. We recommend supplying the Callback as a lambda function.
    • ExecuteRequestBuilder.call(): Starts the Bastion test by executing the HTTP request.

    After using the ExecuteRequestBuilder.call() method, the user may obtain the response, for further use in the ongoing test, using methods defined in the PostExecutionBuilder interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CallbackBuilder<? extends MODEL> withAssertions(Assertions<? super MODEL> assertions)
      Add an assertions object which determines whether the received response is as expected.

      • Methods inherited from interface rocks.bastion.core.builder.CallbackBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • withAssertions

        CallbackBuilder<? extends MODEL> withAssertions(Assertions<? super MODEL> assertions)
        Add an assertions object which determines whether the received response is as expected. We recommend supplying the Assertions object as a lambda or using one of the convenience implementations of Assertions (such as JsonResponseAssertions) that will take care of the most common verifications that a user would want to perform on a request.

        If this method is not called on the builder, then a no-operation assertions object which always pass are set by default.
        Parameters:
        assertions - A non-null Assertions object
        Returns:
        A fluent-builder which will allow you to add callbacks, execute the HTTP request and retrieve the response information
